adrFormatAddress: 2960 Frederick Douglass Blvd, New York, NY 10039-1323, USA

originalText.text: I didn't go here for homelessness, so I'm not entirely sure how that goes at this location. I do know that this is mainly a working shelter for men who wish to reintegrate into their community. There's a gym there for the participants and they serve hot food, that I couldn't eat, but it smelled pretty good. It's located next to basketball courts and a small park across the street from a housing development and a Subway station. This is not a place that you can just walk in, you must be referred there from another social service avenue, and there are security guards on site. There are metal detectors when you get in, so travel light if you ever need to visit. There are a few resident cats hanging around the building that are sometimes friendly and I've seen security feeding them. If you've ever spotted men in the blue outfit cleaning streets or parks, chances are they came from this program. Depending on your opinion of systems serving the homeless population, this can be conflicting, which is why I took one star off, but anything is better than nothing. (I'm basing this off of an uninformed opinion. I have no facts as to who gets paid and where funding goes.) I'm not ashamed to say that I went here for 12 Step Meetings on Saturday mornings. I get the feeling this is the kind of place that can help you, if you want it.

originalText.text: Ready Willing and Able is a wonderful organization whose Mission Statement is to assist formerly homeless and/or incarcerated men in their quests to become gainfully employed and independent. What sets The Doe Fund apart from the multitude of other agencies with similar STATED goals is that they do so by actually employing the gentlemen they provide these services to.  Over 60% of their staff have, at one time or another also been recipients of the services.  It's a wonderful incentive which inspires those who may doubt their own abilities and possibilities.

originalText.text: This is a really great program and they're helping a lot of people this location specifically was very clean I went to do a presentation on housing I think it went very well I was very well received and met some really interesting gentleman there who are really trying to get their life back on track

originalText.text: I owe my life to RWA.  I achieved my drivers license. My exterminator license. A job. Bank account. Apartment and most of all my soberiety til this very day. These things did not fall in my lap. But they do when u apply yourself and take advantage of the blessings they have to offer. Its up to the individual. I suggest you listen to staff. Your peers. And the many, many speaker guests who've once sat in your very seat. This is medicine for me. I listened intently and i shared my experiences with others.  You have to give yourself a fair chance. I did. Im happy now that my life is an actual life now. No longer a member of the walking dead. I will praise this place till the sun burn out. They gave me a chance to address my root of anguish. But one must grab that bull by the horns and give it all u have. No nothing fell in my lap. But things did once i applied myself and finally took full responsibility for myself. Things fall into place. My life has been great. Feb. 7th will be 8 yrs strong. This actually works but u gotta work it...no short cuts. Be as diligent in ur recovery as you were in your addiction. Where odyssey house denied me help when i needed it most. RWA welcomed me with open arms. Dont let no door close before u when ur life is at stake. Thank u Nas. Thank u Ms. J!
